item.title: Report X-2023051237
item.description:
Report X-2023051237

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T18:11:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload. Package had not been loaded upright and was wet on top and one side. Package was placed in hazmat spill tote and removed from work area. Corrosive liquid made no contact with skin. Minor external leakage was cleaned up with spill absorbent powder. DescribePack: Upon inspection, 1 jug of corrosive liquid was found to have a loose cap and seal. This combined with improper loading caused contents to leak out and onto remaining 3 jugs. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package immediately placed in hazmat spill tote and removed from work area. Minor spillage was cleaned up with spill absorbent powder.

item.title: Report X-2023050774
item.description:
Report X-2023050774

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T18:11:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND WAS WET FURTHER INSPECTION FOUND ONE OF THE 4 GLASS BOTTLES BROKEN. THERE WERE MODED FORMS FOR THE BOTTLES BUT THER WAS NO PACKING BETWEEN THE GLASS BOTTLES TO PREVENT THEM FROM HITTING EACH OTHER DescribePack: FAILED IN THE PACKAGING GLASS BOTTLES MADE CONTACT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM THE OTHER PACKAGES

  • City: CONNERSVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Tanker was in in-transient storage when employee noticed a little material coming out of the knock off valve. When examined the knocked out valve the gasket was found to be bad (the valve has been overtightened). the gasket was changed and material was cleaned up in house and trailer was reinspected for no leaks before shipping. the Material also leaked because the trailer was in containment which is sloped with the back of the trailer lower than the front where the valve is located.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING IN AN INBOUND PRELOAD TRAILER UPON OPENING OF THE TRAILER. UNLOADER STOPPED THE BELT, NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO CALLED FOR A HAZMAT RESPONDER. RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH SPILL CART. DONNED PPE AND RESPONDED TO THE INCIDENT USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER THEN TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING OF AN AIR PACKAGE, AEROSOL RATTLE SOUNDS WERE HEARD COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER OPENED PACKAGE TO FIND TWO 12 OUNCE HARVEST RED AEROSOL CANS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING AEROSOLS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-10
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At some point during transit, caps on bottles became loose and liquid spilled out of bottles and soaked through box. Although box was wet and damaged, no other packages appeared to have been damaged as a result of the leak. Package was caught in the unload and taken to damages to be processed. DescribePack: Caps on the bottles were loose. After discovery of the leak, caps were retightened. Solution dried on the bottles in the package and caused the box to be wet with the solution. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a damage tote and sent to damage area upon discovery in the unload.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER ALERTED ME TO A LEAKING HAZMAT IN UNLOAD. UPON INSPECTION, THE PACKAGE CONTAINED FOUR GALLONS OF CLEANING SOLUTION, I PLACED IT IN A TOTE LINED WITH A PLASTIC BAG AND BEGAN THE DAMAGED HAZMAT PROCESS. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE OF THE SOLUTION HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING ABOUT HALF A CUP OF THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A PLASTIC LINED TOTE AND REMOVED FROM THE AREA.

item.title: Report E-2023050170
item.description:
Report E-2023050170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T00:36:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 3rd, 2023 at 1931 personnel in the CSXT Howell Yard discovered NATX38424, a loaded tank car of Acetone leaking from the protective housing. The car was isolated the shipper was notified (CHEMTREC Report #2023-05-03-00321). Marion environmental Inc., a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a steady drip coming from the protective housing, upon further inspection it was determined the liquid line valve was not in the closed position and the secondary securement plug had no thread sealant allowing product to pass through the valve. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative- Ara Rainey, ara.rainey@sabic.com, 812-833-1558. Contractor personnel closed the valve, applied thread tape to, and properly secured, the secondary closure plug. and applied thread tape to the secondary securement plug.

  • Description: On 4-13-2023 at approximately 1800, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 868809 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a corrosive liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 7 fiberboard boxes, each containing 38 plastic bottles with 2000 ml of liquid per bottle. One of the boxes was discovered leaking. Further investigation revealed that the damaged package was punctured by an unknown object, causing one of the bottles to completely leak. The damaged bottle and outer package were prepared for disposal and the remaining bottles were placed in a salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: On March 21, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing resin (UN1866) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) new 95-gallon overpack, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all resin impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

X-2023030718 SequenceEvent: package was loaded on its side. When package it was sat up right. DescribePack: because package was loaded on its side it caused the cap to come or leak out. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: spill was cleaned up and package was sat in hazmat tote 3. X-2023030720 SequenceEvent: Package was loaded onto its side. Package was sat up right DescribePack: bottles crushed one another causing the caps to come off and leaked out. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned up and package was put into hazmat liner and tote. 4. X-2023030721 SequenceEvent: package was loaded onto its side. package was sat up right. DescribePack: bottles inside were crushed leaking out DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: package was put into hazmat liner and tote

item.title: Report E-2023030373
item.description:
Report E-2023030373

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-15
  • City: FORT WAYNE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1028 ET, XPO terminal XFW contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer and on the dock, in Ft. Wayne, IN. The spill consisted of a 330-gallon plastic tote containing UN2735 AO-24, which was being unloaded off the trailer when XPO personnel noticed a trail of liquid leading up to the dock, and it then began gushing once it was set down. The terminal coned off the area. ERT dispatched a contractor for cleanup assistance. Contractors arrived onsite at 1255 ET. Crew confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to an 8' x 8' area of the dock floor and a 2' x 15' area of the trailer floor. Contractors stated the side of the tote was cracked due to a possible puncture occurring as a result of load shift. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: NOTIFIDED OF LEAKER OUTSIDE OF TRAILER AT 88 DOOR. RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE. PPE USED WAS GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, GLOVES USING THE SILVER SHILD LINER FOLLOWING THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. PH TESTED AS A 1. APPLIED SODIUM BICARBONATE AND USED CLAY BASED ABSORBENT TO CLEAN UP THE FLOOR AND CART. RESPONDER RETESTED THE SPILLED MATERIAL WITH PH TAPE AND ENSURED IT WAS WITHIN THE NEUTRAL RANGE. ALL MATERIAL WAS CONTAINERIZED USING A PLASTIC DUSTPAN AND FIBER BROOM. ALL SPILL RESIDUE WAS REMOVED FROM THE SPILL LOCATION AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023030176
item.description:
Report E-2023030176

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-06
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/6/2023, a Non-Accident Release involving GATX36187, a loaded tank car of Sulfuric Acid, spent, un1832, was observed leaking from the service equipment housing at the top of the car. The car was isolated and Brandon Davis a representative of Phillips 66, (504-416-7580, Brandon.J.Davis@p66.com was notified. The National Response Center, Indiana DEM, and CHEMTREC (Report# 2023-0306-00286) were also notified. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid valve in the open position and the secondary closure not in place resulting in a hazardous materials release. The issue was identified, and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper representative, Brandon Davis. Contractor personnel positioned the valve in the closed position, installed and secured the 4-bolt flange secondary closure and cleaned up released product impacting the tank car and the ballast below. The car was released for transportation. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 not required. Cause Code:254 NARRI:110

item.title: Report I-2023030078
item.description:
Report I-2023030078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-13
  • City: GREENFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BULK TRANSPORT COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The driver left the roadway within a construction zone, the truck struck a stormwater culvert, and the truck and trailer rolled over into the ditch on the shoulder of the highway, which contained stormwater that is a tributary to Buck Creek. The cargo leaked from the dome lid while the truck was rolled over. Once the truck and trailer were uprighted, the spill was stopped. A total of 3,540 lbs of a 40% to 50% ferric sulfate cargo(1,460 to 1,770 lbs, approximately 282 gallons) spilled into the water. The product is soluble in water. So, the ferric sulfate was not recoverable. The pH at the point of loss was impacted, causing a small fish kill. The pH downstream was not impacted, due to dilution, and the pH at the loss site was back to 5 to 6 s.u. the following day. Approximately 10 gallons of engine oil and 10 gallons diesel fuel also spilled and absorbent booms were deployed in the ditch and downstream in the creek to contain the petroleum products. The petroleum-impacted soil will be excavated once DOT approves the permit, most likely after the construction project is completed in Summer 2023. The remaining product was transloaded on February 16, 2023 and it was noted that some of the cargo was absorbed into exposed insulation of the tanker. Original Weight was 43,980& Transloaded Weight was 40,440

  • Description: Unit was loaded at Eli Lilly and was picked up by our driver. Unit was taken to Evonik for unloading, once under the unloading rack, an employee at Evonik noticed there was some minor spillage in the crash box and notified management. Employee noticed the dust cap was left off of loading attachment in the crash box allowing some product to splash out of tank into crash box. At the Eli Lilly location, customers are not allowed to go on top of tank and inspect unit due to safety protocol. Liquid Transport driver was unable to perform proper pre-trip of crash box before leaving Eli Lilly. Eli Lilly employee does not recall if dust cap was connected prior to tanker leaving Eli Lilly facility. When this tanker was prepared for shipping by Eli Lilly, there was some lighting issues in the loading area due to a breaker being tripped and that has since been addressed.

item.description:
Report E-2023020560

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-20
  • City: NEW CARLISLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 20, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing caustic alkali liquids experienced a faulty valve and released approximately 100 gallons of product to the trailer floor and concrete parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC who dispatched a crew from Response Management Services, LLC (RMS) to assess the site and initiate corrective action. RMS personnel removed the adjacent freight and gravity transferred the virgin product into a new tote. RMS deployed absorbents and collected all UN1719-impacted material into twelve (12) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023020990
item.description:
Report X-2023020990

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-10
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLNOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/10/2023 at approximately 10:00 AM CST a CN mechanical employee observed a red liquid dripping down the side of tank car # SHPX 204689 while performing an inbound train inspection at the CN Kirk Yard in Gary, Indiana. The leak was reported to the CN Dangerous Goods Officer who subsequently responded to the incident. The responding CN DGO observed liquid dripping from the bottom of the protective housing which had a security seal intact. The seal was removed and all valves were inspected for leakage and finding the "Liquid Eduction Line Securement Flange" to be dripping as a result of the (4) securement fasteners to be less than tool tight which allowed the internal pressure to force liquid up and out of the loose flange. The (4) flange fasteners were tightened with an 12" adjustable wrench until the leak was stopped. The internal pressure was then released through the 1" vapor valve. The liquid line securement flange was removed for the purpose of inspecting the gasket which appeared to be un-damaged. The securement flange was again re-installed. The rail car was sent to an isolation track within the rail yard for exterior decontamination and then released back into transportation.

DG Admin instructed the station to place the package into a salvage drum and hold until further instructed.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1320 ET, XPO logistics terminal XCM called to report a 1-quart release of UN3267 Corrguard FS due to a forklift puncture that impacted the dock at dock floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum, impacted absorbent and pads were containerized into a 95-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM THE OTHER PACKAGES. 2. X-2023010375 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED METAL PAIL FAILED AT THE TOP LID, CAUSING FLAMMABLE "KRYLON QUIK DRY PAINT" TO LEAK. METAL PAIL CONSISTED OF 5 GALLONS OF PAINT, AND 2 GALLONS SPILLED. DescribePack: METAL PAIL FAILED AT THE TOP LID, DENTING AT TOP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A LIMITED QUANTITY, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM THE OTHER PACKAGES.

  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO PICK UP A CORROSIVE LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER ARRIVED IN PPE WITH DECISION TREE. THE PACKAGE HAD NOT LEAKED ONTO THE FLOOR OF THE PACKAGE CAR, BUT THE BOX WAS WET FROM THE INSIDE AS SEEN BY THE DAMP CARDBOARD CORNER AND BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER PUT IT IN THE SPILL TUB AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. THE PACKAGE HAD A CORROSIVE DIAMOND ON THE PACKAGE AND SHIPPING PAPERS THAT HAD BEEN AUDITED. THERE WAS AN INVOICE AND CERTIFICATE OF COMPLIANCE. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report E-2022120048
item.description:
Report E-2022120048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-01
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0939 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XIN. It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of UN1263 Dura Coat 6462 Elixir Victory Red released from a 50-gallon metal drum due to the drum being punctured while unloading. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 10' x 10' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon metal overpack. The impacted absorbents and all cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022120550
item.description:
Report X-2022120550

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-21
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PLASTIC JERRICAN WAS FOUND AT APPROX. 5 AM UPRIGHT ON THE GROUND, SET ASIDE BY THE PACKAGE HANDLERS WORKING THE TUGGER STATION. THICK GREY SCOTCH TAPE WAS COVERING BOTH THE SEAL AND RELEASE VALVE OPENINGS. LIQUID WAS POOLING UNDERNEATH THE TAPE AND DOWN THE SIDES OF THE CAN. THE CAN WAS THEN WIPED WITH ABSORBENT PADS, AS WELL AS THE 1TSP OF LIQUID ON THE FLOOR FOUND NEARBY THE CAN. AFTER WIPING, MORE LIQUID WAS FOUND SEEPING THROUGH THE TAPE, INDICATING THE FAILURE WAS WITH THE HAZMAT. DescribePack: SEALS WERE NOT PROPERLY FITTED OR TAPED OVER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PROMPTLY SET ON A CART AND IN A QA AREA. MORE ABSORBENT PADS WERE USED ON THE FLOOR WHERE THE CAN HAD PREVIOUSLY SAT.

item.title: Report E-2022120012
item.description:
Report E-2022120012

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-30
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0322 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XIN. It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of UN2920 Tamen Q15 was released from 275 gallon plastic tote due to punctured in transit. The release impacted trailer floor and asphalt under the trailer. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 15' x 15' area of the trailer floor and asphalt lot below due to a pallet puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected. The product was transferred into a new tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all spent absorbents and all cleanup debris into a three 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: 3 Drums of Ink material was shipped as a non-hazardous waste. Once analysis was done by the lab, it was determined that the material was ignitable and thus hazardous. The material flashed at <100F. The material did ship on a hazardous waste manifest (02702266JJK) with other hazardous waste batch groups. We were able to change the shipping description of the material on the manifest and added the proper waste codes. We discussed the situation with the customer.

  • Description: On November 9, 2022, one (1) 50-pound bag of potassium hydroxide was torn during unloading and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to assess and remediate the site. ISR personnel utilized and tools to sweep the released material into one (1) 55-gallon drum, then dissolved the material with water and citric acid for neutralization and disposal.

  • Description: The material shipped as 28/ 55-gallon drums of flammable liquids for recycling on a bill of lading. Upon receipt, it was determined the drums were not going to be recycled. This resulted in the material not qualifying as a hazardous secondary material. The material will be managed as a hazardous waste with the waste codes of F003, D001, D035. Reclaimed Energy is permitted to take these codes. A hazardous waste manifest was issued for the shipment and sent to the generator for signatures. Generator has notified of situation and that unmanifested waste report would be completed.

  • City: GARY

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 23, 2022 at approximately 08:30 CDT during an inspection of tank car PROX 43062, Load, Styrene Monomer, Stabilized, UN 2055, Class 3, PG III, at the CN Kirk Yard, Gary, IN., a CN Mechanical crew observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet area. The railcar was isolated, all required notifications made. CN Response team responded and upon closer inspection observed a small leak emanating from the bottom outlet valve flange area. The bolts were checked for tightness, and one was able to be tightened 1/2 turn and an adjacent bolt was tightened 1/4 turn, securing the leak. The area and the exterior surface of the tank car was decontaminated and observed for 30 minutes.

item.title: Report E-2022100818
item.description:
Report E-2022100818

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-20
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 06:9 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XCW. It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of UN3267 3D TRASAR 3DT199 released from a 400-gallon metal tote due to the seal on the tote being damaged. The release impacted the sides of the metal tote. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to access the tote and conduct cleanup. At 1329 ET, FCE arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to the top of the tote due to a faulty bung. The bung cap was replaced, and a slosh test conducted to ensure no release. The tote was wiped down and all waste collected into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022101153
item.description:
Report X-2022101153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-20
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the sort operation at the Fedex hub in Indianapolis a fiberboard box was observed to be leaking. Further investigation indicated the box contained possible undeclared dangerous goods. The fiberboard box contained another box labeled as a 4.2 UN1378 and inside of that was a 5-gallon bucket that was damaged and leaking. This was a multi piece shipment of 3 and all 3 contained the same commodity. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the outer packages and no shipper's declaration offered with the shipment. A shipper's declaration dated 9/26/22 was discovered inside of one of the fiberboard boxes. The leaking package was placed into a steel salvage package and all 3 pieces are being held for the FAA at the location.

INSIDE CONTENTS HAD AN INTERNAL LEAKAGE FROM FAILURE OF LOOSE CAPS CAUSING DAMAGE TO ENTIRE PACKAGE. DescribePack: FAILED AT THE TOP LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM THE OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report E-2022100420
item.description:
Report E-2022100420

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-05
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 5, 2022, at 0130 ET, XPO Logistics reported that a 250 gallon poly tote of UN3082 arrived punctured and released its contents in the trailer and out into the yard. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup operations. On October 5, 2022, at 0610 ET, Hepaco personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 150 gallons of product released to a 30' x 30' area of the trailer floor and asphalt lot below. The remaining product in the tote was transferred out into drums and solidified. Absorbents were worked into all impacted areas and then collected. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all absorbent impacted material into (8) 55 gallon metal drums and (3) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022100414
item.description:
Report E-2022100414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-01
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO requested a team for a spill of UN3265 "POLYSTEP HPE" from a 55 gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to conduct cleanup. On October 1, 2022, at 0835 ET, FCE personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20 gallons of product released to an 8' x 12' area of the concrete dock floor. Absorbent was first worked into the impacted area and then collected. The area was then swept with soda ash. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95 gallon poly drum. All cleanup debris was placed into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2022100064

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-19
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2022 at 2207 ET, XPO Terminal XCM reported a 2 gallon spill of UN3266 ProClean® FOAM SAFE from a 55 gallon plastic drum caused by improper loading. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to conduct cleanup. On September 20, 2022, at 0220 ET, FCE arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20 gallons of product released to a 3' x 4' area of the trailer and a 6' area of the concrete dock floor. First Call recovered the product with absorbents and neutralized the area. One 55 gallon poly drum and one 95 gallon poly drum of waste were generated containing the damaged drum and all cleanup debris. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090214
item.description:
Report E-2022090214

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-07
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/7/22, at 1636 hrs., personnel in the CSXT Avon Yard, noted a strong vinegar odor in the yard near UTLX647315, a loaded tank car of Acetic Acid, Glacial, which was possibly leaking. The car was isolated and Celanese LTD, NRC, and IDEM were notified. CHEMTREC#2022-0907-00387. Hepaco, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the Liquid Line blind flange nuts securing the valve to the pressure plate less then tool tight and the entire valve could be moved by hand. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Travis Robertson 713-816-7085. Contractor personnel secured the Liquid Line, remediated impacted ballast and tank car. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport, pending OTMA-1 approval. This incident did require a special switching move. 7.1 is required. Cause Code: 242 NARRI: 5

  • Description: On 08/27/22, at 0730, personnel in the CSXT Avon Yard, noted a line of tank cars which included TILX402124, a residue tank car of Acetaldehyde, possibly emitting a vapor odor from the protective housing. The car was isolated and Vertellus Integrated, NRC, and IDEM were notified. CHEMTREC#2022-0827-00107. Hepaco, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapor line secondary plug less then tool tight, and the vapor line valve open approximately 1/8 inch. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Kathy Amick 317-417-6045. Contractor personnel closed the vapor line and secured the secondary plug. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. No, 7.1 is required. Cause Code: 136 NARRI: 5

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being transported on NC conveyor belt when a jam occurred, causing hazmat package to fall off of conveyor and land sideways. Shortly thereafter, package was found to be leaking paint. No human contact was made with leaking substance. Hazmat was placed in hazmat spill tote and placed under ventilation fan in hazmat processing area. Spill absorbent placed on spill, swept up once absorbed and disposed of safely. DescribePack: Both cans of primer were found to be dented on top and bottom. At least one was found to have a loose cap, but the second was covered in primer, making it difficult to tell if it was actually leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed in hazmat spill tote and placed under ventilation fan in hazmat processing area. Spill absorbent placed on spill, swept up once absorbed and disposed of safely.

item.title: Report E-2022080889
item.description:
Report E-2022080889

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-06T21:10:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-18
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/18/2022, at 1722 hrs., personnel in the CSXT Avon Yard discovered GATX70394, a loaded tank car of 2-EthylHexyl Acrylate Inhibited, leaking from under the protective housing. The car was isolated and BASF, IDEM, and NRC were notified. CHEMTREC Report # 2022-0818-00366. Hepaco, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found product leaking from the liquid line under the unsecure less then tool tight secondary plug, additionally 4 of 4 blind flange bolts securing the liquid valve to the pressure plate were found less then tool tight. The liquid line valve handle was in the closed position. Hepaco also found a securement pin on a second protective housing broke. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Michael Doring, 225-339-2585, michael.doring@basf.com. Contractor personnel secured the secondary plug, tightened four liquid line flange bolts, secured the protective housing pin on the secondary compartment, and remediated the free standing liquid. The leak was secured a filtered air blanket was placed on the tank and the car was released for transport. This incident did require a special switching move and will require a 7.1 report. Cause Code: 118 NARRI: 5

Suckow saw the corrosive placards and contacted Hunter Hall in Safety for further instructions. 050 downstacked the pallet that was damaged onto a new pallet, placing 3 damaged pails in hazmat containment kits. 050 moved the MP forward slightly in order to see if any liquid had leaked onto the floor of the warehouse underneath the MP. 050 identified a large puddle of liquid and put oil dry/floor sweep on the MP as well as the floor of the warehouse. That will be placed in containment kits as well.

THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED PLASTIC TOTE AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP WHERE THE BROKEN GLASS WAS DISPOSED OF AND THE REMAINING CONTAINERS WERE PROCESSED.

  • Description: On August2, 2022, six (6) 5-gallon drums of acetone (contains resin solution) released approximately a half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior due to a manufacture defect. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response, LLC (ISR) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ISR personnel drummed the damaged product and containerized all UN1866 impacted material into two (2) 55-gallon drums, then utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted surface.

  • Description: Indianapolis spill agent was called about a class 3 package and was informed that the package had been dropped during the unloading process. After receiving the package they noticed that there was a grey substance on the top seems and bottom of the fiberboard box. While investigating the package it was discovered that the top on 1 of the 4 cans inside had come off and spilled all of its contents. Inside of the fiberboard box the cans were separated with a fiberboard divider and all cans had positive closure rings. The package was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

  • Description: PACKAGE WAS OFFERED TO THE SPILL OFFICE AT THE INDIANAPOLIS HUB WHEN IT WAS SEEN THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE SHOWED DISCOLORATION WHICH INDICATED A POSSIBLE SPILL INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS A FIBERBOARD BOX CONTAINING 4 BOTTLES OF UN 2031. THERE WAS NO ABSORBANT MATERIAL, MOSITURE BARRIERS, OR POSITIVE CLOSURE ON ANY OF THE PLASTIC BOTTLES. INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE FOUND THAT THE CAPS ON TWO OF THE BOTTLES HAD LOOSENED AND ALLOWED FOR COMMODITY TO LEAK OUT OF THE BOTTLES. PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A STEEL SALVAGE DRUM AND SHIPPER CONTACTED FOR DISPOSITION.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE AREA WAS CONTAINED, THE HAZMAT WAS PLACED IN A DRUM AND CHEMICAL NEUTRALIZER WAS PLACED OVER THE SPILL.
